image.altText: Two firefighters walk toward a blaze among trees in Los Angeles

props.synopsis: Firefighters in Los Angeles are gearing up to combat another day of heightened wind gusts, as the death toll from the city's wildfires rose to 16 and entire communities were left in ruins.

title.children: Firefighters race to contain LA wildfires as winds grow

image.altText: A woman in a pink puffer and a short blonde bob smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: The mother of an Australian man killed in the Los Angeles wildfires has recounted her desperate efforts to save her son and has urged people to remember him as a "courageous" and "beautiful soul".

title.children: 'Mum, just leave me': Mother fought to end to save Australian son in LA fire

image.altText: A white helicopter dropping water over spots of flame on a hill with dark trees as two firefighters in yellow watch on

props.synopsis: Since January 1, more than 101 wildfires have broken out across California. The state's fire department has deployed what is says is "the largest civil aerial firefighting fleet worldwide" to extinguish the flames.

title.children: Watch the 'world's largest' water-bombing fleet in action against the LA fires

image.altText: President Donald Trump delivers his inaugural address

props.synopsis: US President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration will be attended by Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong as well as other foreign dignitaries as Australia seeks to dodge punishing tariffs promised by the populist leader.

title.children: 'Expand our cooperation': Penny Wong to attend Trump's swearing-in ceremony

image.altText: A closed road outside the sign for the Fogg Dam Conservation Reserve

props.synopsis: A man has died and a woman is in hospital after a light aircraft crashed into the Fogg Dam recreational area south-east of Darwin.

title.children: Man dies in light plane crash south-east of Darwin

image.altText: Adam Walton clenches his fist

props.synopsis: Two-time defending champion Aryna Sabalenka is through to the second round, as Aussie Adam Walton takes on Quentin Halys. Follow live.

title.children: Aussies Adam Walton, Daria Saville in action as Aryna Sabalenka wins

image.altText: US Special Counsel Jack Smith looks down, holding a brown leather file as he stands at a podium in a business suit.

props.synopsis: Jack Smith resigns after pursuing cases against Trump on charges of trying to overturn his 2020 election defeat, and mishandling classified documents.

title.children: Trump prosecutor Jack Smith resigns after submitting DOJ report

image.altText: A person walks in front of Australian Open signage wearing a rain coat and holding an umbrella.

props.synopsis: Flash flooding hit parts of Melbourne on Sunday, with the deluge halting play at the Australian Open.

title.children: Wild weather hits Melbourne as BOM issues severe thunderstorm warning

image.altText: A man in a suit smiling and waving

props.synopsis: He's a mysterious billionaire with a penchant for exotic animals and art, but some say behind Bidzina Ivanishvili's eccentricities lie something much more serious: the ability to change Georgia's "entire trajectory".

title.children: A tiny Soviet state is in chaos. A shark-owning billionaire could be to blame

props.synopsis: In a rare protest, a group of people have clashed with police outside a vocational school in China's northwestern Shaanxi province, where a student died earlier this month.

title.children: Chinese protesters clash with police following student's death

image.altText: A koala in a gum tree, with its arms around a joey.

props.synopsis: More than 60 endangered koalas have been discovered living in bushland around a dam in regional New South Wales. Ecologists and landowners are working to ensure the colony continues to thrive.

title.children: Koalas are thriving in this hotspot but researchers aren't sure why

image.altText: Alyssa Healy looks on after playing a shot

props.synopsis: A half-century from captain Alyssa Healy and an all-round display from Ash Gardner lead Australia to a comfortable four-wicket victory over England in the first ODI of the Women's Ashes at North Sydney Oval.

title.children: Healy and Gardner lead Australia to victory over England in opening Ashes ODI

image.altText: A bird flies by as the sun rises behind an aircraft

props.synopsis: Solving the mystery behind December's Jeju Air disaster becomes more difficult, with authorities revealing the black boxes failed to record the aircraft's final four minutes.

title.children: South Korean plane crash mystery deepens with missing black box minutes

image.altText: An air tanker leaves a trail of red foam

props.synopsis: Los Angeles firefighters continue to battle the spreading blazes, as authorities warn intense winds are keeping the threat high.

title.children: Palisades fire spreads in windy conditions — the latest from the LA wildfires

image.altText: Peter Dutton enters Liberal rally Chisholm election

props.synopsis: Liberal leader Peter Dutton launches the party's campaign to win government at this year's federal election, saying the Coalition can do a better job to turn around the decline in living standards.

title.children: Dutton makes case to become PM, rallying Liberal faithful at launch

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man with his hands in the air in front of a yacht

props.synopsis: Authorities say the 77-year-old hasn't been seen since leaving Emu Point Marina in Albany just after midday on December 29.

title.children: Search for missing yachtsman Maurice Saunderson off WA coast suspended

image.altText: Jannik Sinner kisses the Norman Brookes Challenge Cup.

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios wants transparency, Novak Djokovic thinks there's a doping double standard in tennis and Jannik Sinner is saying very little as his stoush with WADA at the CAS looms large.

title.children: 'No chance': Why tennis's doping double standard isn't fair and Sinner's case shows it

image.altText: A graphic image, half of two young girls smiling in a black and white photo, the other of the dunes of a beach.

props.synopsis: The loved ones of Marianne Schmidt and Christine Sharrock have been plagued by unimaginable loss. It all began on the Wanda Beach sand dunes in Sydney's south 60 years ago.

title.children: Family of Wanda Beach victims reflect on pitiful reward payment

image.altText: An office worker talks on his phone as he looks the stock board at the Australian Securities Exchange

props.synopsis: It's widely accepted the US stock market, AKA Wall Street, is currently overpriced or overvalued.

title.children: Evidence is building of a Wall Street investment 'bubble' with implications for Australia

image.altText: Man holds baby in the afternoon sun.

props.synopsis: In the red centre, town camps can get a bad reputation. But the people living there say they are misunderstood, and in their homes family comes first.

title.children: Inside the lives of the people who live on the outskirts of Alice Springs

image.altText: Zelenskyy stands next to two burly soldiers in combat gear, all looking up to something above them

props.synopsis: Two North Korean soldiers fighting for Russia in Kursk have been captured by Ukraine's military, the president says.

title.children: Ukraine captures first North Korean soldiers, Zelenskyy claims

image.altText: cctv image of two people dressed in black hoodies one on a bike outside a synagogue in newtown

props.synopsis: NSW counter terrorism police have taken over all investigations into anti-Semitic incidents at synagogues in Sydney following a string vandalism reports.

title.children: Counter terrorism police investigate anti-Semitic incidents in Sydney

image.altText: A burning house with a tornado of flames stands next to a charred pile of ruins

props.synopsis: Days before one of the largest wildfires the area has ever seen broke out in southern California, there were warnings — the region was a tinderbox.

title.children: The Los Angeles hills were a tinderbox by the time disaster struck

image.altText: a graphic of twins nuno and bruno da silva with a bike and palm trees behind

props.synopsis: One brother argued the motorcycle would be his "only form of transport" upon release and no "illegitimate sources" funded its purchase.

title.children: Seized Harley Davidsons returned to ex-bikie, meth-trafficking twins

image.altText: Two men in their bridal suits on their wedding day smiling beside a woman wearing a white dress and shell earrings.

props.synopsis: For Beth, Koraly and Sashi, broadening the idea of what makes a family has allowed them to create, celebrate and accept theirs.

title.children: 'More than enough': How three women embraced different types of family

image.altText: A black ute on a trailer

props.synopsis: Police have seized a Holden Commodore believed to have been involved in a hit-and-run that critically injured a four-year-old boy on the Victorian–NSW border.

title.children: Car seized as police investigate hit-and-run that injured 4yo boy

image.altText: A woman looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Consumers have accused Melbourne beauty store Botanifique of aggressive sales tactics that led to them to spending hundreds or thousands of dollars on products.

title.children: Why a purchase from a beauty shop left Katherine 'breaking down'

image.altText: Police walking over a crime tape

props.synopsis: A man is in a critical condition after a shooting in Brisbane's south.

title.children: Man in critical condition after shooting in Brisbane's south

image.altText: A large crowd of people gathered in a town square, with a large prominent sign reading 'Get Tough on Crime'

props.synopsis: The rate of Aboriginal people taken into custody in the NT each day has increased 123 per cent in the past five years. How did we get here?

title.children: Each day, 41 Aboriginal people are taken into custody in the NT

image.altText: A woman stands in a park holding her baby

props.synopsis: The social and cognitive benefits of knowing two or more languages, especially from childhood, are well-established. Here's how experts say it can be done.

title.children: How to raise bilingual children in Australia, where English reigns supreme

image.altText: basketball player holding ball with white shirt

props.synopsis: Cairns Taipans player Jackson Makoi was arrested just hours before he was to play against his old team the Sydney Kings.

title.children: NBL player charged with common assault, choking hours before match

image.altText: A woman named Paola Borquez Arce smiles as she speaks.

props.synopsis: Journalists all have one thing in common — a reliable contact book. But if you're from a diverse background, chances are there are barriers to getting on that call list.

title.children: 'Go with the name you know' highlights the media's struggles with diversity

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Refreshed and relaxed after a little break? How nice. That ends now.

title.children: Think you're clever? Prove it. Let's see where that confidence gets you

image.altText: Fremantle Dockers players rub the head of Caleb Serong.

props.synopsis: For 38 years the West Coast Eagles have been WA footy's alpha male, but in the midst of their worst ever on-field run, is the balance of power shifting towards their bitter rivals Fremantle?

title.children: Can 'perennial underachievers' Fremantle become WA's biggest footy club?
